poster.headline: CEO | Founder @Promofy - Your Gamification Partner. Entrepreneur | Founder | Co-Founder | CEO | iGaming Consultant | Angel Investor | 12+ year Experienced C-Level Executive |

text:
‚ú® Some moments feel bigger because of the road that leads to them.

üß≠ ICE has been part of my story for almost a decade.

It was the first major conference where I truly saw the scale, ambition, and creativity of this industry üåç

Back then, it was pure inspiration, a moment that quietly shaped many decisions that followed.

‚è© Fast forward to ICE Barcelona 2026 üá™üá∏

üèÜ PROMOFY winning the ICE Pitch feels proud. 

Not just as an achievement, but as a full-circle moment from being inspired by others on stage to having our own vision recognised üé§

‚ö° The conference itself was intense in the best way possible.
Three days. Full calendar. Non-stop meetings. Real conversations about the future of engagement, loyalty, and how brands connect with users ü§ù

üôè Thank you to the organisers, judges, partners, and future partners for the trust and belief that what we‚Äôre building truly matters.

Paris Smith Maxime Sbeghen Jeff Millar Adam Rosenberg Meir Shachar

üíú And above all, this win belongs to our small, united, relentlessly driven team. Vakhtang Mdivani, Negin Namazi and All others. 

Behind every pitch, every meeting, every result, there‚Äôs discipline, ownership, and belief.

üöÄ Proud of how far we‚Äôve come.

üîÆ Excited for what we‚Äôre about to achieve next.

When I arrived in Winnipeg in March, I was looking for a place that valued "Builders" - people who care more about shipping code than making slides. I found that home at Hilltop Partner Network.

I am honored to step into the role of Chief Technology Officer (CTO).
A huge thank you to Geoff Besko, Ren√©e Riglin, and the leadership team for betting on a newcomer and trusting me with the technical vision. And to the engineering crew - thank you for making me look good every day.

We have a lot of "cooking" to do in 2026. Let's get to work. üèóÔ∏è

poster.headline: Co-Founder and CEO at GCast

text:
For this third trip I took GCast, the app that turns your phone into a gaming console to Lisbon ! 

A busy week with DevGAMM and #websummit, back to back.

GCast was demoed to over 100+ people, and everybody was amazed by how easy it is to cast mobile games, alone or with friends, on the PC or TV - even with the conference's wifi !
 
Few facts : 
¬†üéÆ Cast any mobile game to a TV (16ms latency)
¬†ü§ñ AI companion reading the screen in real-time
¬†üñ•Ô∏è Split the screen to play with your friends
¬†üõ†Ô∏è SDK integration for Unity/Unreal in minutes- 30 meetings ‚Üí 23 followups
¬†üí∏ Met with 10+ investors wanting a part of the action! 

Special shoutout to Enchant. Gaming and AI Startup accelerator for two wonderful events!

Special thanks to friends and all those I had the wonderful pleasure to meet along the way:

poster.headline: Tech Entrepreneur | Printomato.com

text:
I just made a pleasant discovery ü§ì 

I asked ChatGPT to deep research and map the global photobooth market from different angles. I expected the usual list of manufacturers, rental companies, and 360 rigs.

While reading the results, I noticed something unexpected:
Printomato üçÖ showed up as part of the market landscape as "a market gap and unmet needs". Not because the system ‚Äúknows‚Äù me, but because our model now appears in public sources as a new category.

1. A venue device instead of a rental booth.
2. Free prints covered by ads.
3. Always-on placement for bars, cafes, and hotels.
& Still almost no direct alternatives globally.

Frankly, seeing our product appear in neutral research gave me a different perspective. It felt like looking at the industry from the outside and spotting the gap we decided to fill.

It‚Äôs a small thing, but it shows that the work is starting to leave a mark.

Building something new is slow. Then one day you notice signs that it‚Äôs becoming real. ü§´

P.S. You can do this for your own company as well. It‚Äôs a quick way to see whether your work is starting to register in the ecosystem.

poster.headline: CEO | Founder @Promofy - Your Gamification Partner. Entrepreneur | Founder | Co-Founder | CEO | iGaming Consultant | Angel Investor | 12+ year Experienced C-Level Executive |

text:
SBC Lisbon and PROMOFY this year was more than just a 3-day marathon of meetings (though it definitely felt like one üòÖ). 

As I sit here recovered from the inevitable conference virus ü¶†, I‚Äôm reminded of something simple but powerful: Health always comes first.

Every meeting opened a door, every conversation sparked an idea, and every opportunity reminded me why we do what we do: building the future of engagement and loyalty. üöÄ

One thought keeps circling in my mind: our industry needs more understanding of gamification than ever. 

Walking through the halls, speaking with operators, platform providers, and innovators, one thing became clear: players today expect more. More interaction. More personalization. More reasons to stay loyal beyond the game itself.

I‚Äôm grateful to the organisers Rasmus Sojmark for building this incredible event, and to all the partners and professionals we‚Äôve shared ideas with. Together, we‚Äôre not just networking ‚Äî we‚Äôre shaping what‚Äôs next.

Anyone who missed me at the show, please PM to talk for real scale and partnerships through our Tech and Expertise. 

Next Stop SBC Summit Tbilisi, See You in Hometown 

#promofyai #aigamification #retention #sbc #lisbon #innovation #loyalty

poster.headline: CTO @ Hilltop Partner Network | Engineering Leadership & AI Strategy | Building 0-to-1 Tech | Georgia to Winnipeg üç∑

text:
Marking a new professional chapter here in Canada (details coming soon) with my first pay stub brought on a classic newcomer moment: the tax rate.

It would be easy to complain. But instead of getting stuck on the numbers, my tech-focused mind decided to reframe it.

üëâ I'm not paying taxes. I've subscribed to 'Canada Premium'.

When you look at it that way, the feature list is fascinating:

- Core Service: Endless perspectives, world-class education, beautiful nature, freedom of self-expression and the list goes on.
- The Canada Child Benefit? It's Referral Bonus: The commission for bringing new users (my kids) to the platform.
- The pension plan? It's a Loyalty Program. The best cash-back program on the market.

All jokes aside, this simple mental shift from "cost" to "investment" has been powerful. It's a constant reminder of the value we get in return and the society we are all collectively building. It turns an obligation into a stake in the outcome.

Whether you're a newcomer still figuring things out or you've been a "subscriber" for generations, I'm curious - how do you perceive it?

#LifeInCanada #Newcomer #Taxes #Mindset #Winnipeg #PersonalFinance

attributes.headline: CTO @ Hilltop Partner Network | Engineering Leadership & AI Strategy | Building 0-to-1 Tech | Georgia to Winnipeg üç∑

resharer_comment:
I'm thrilled to share that I'm starting my next chapter with Hilltop Partner Network. Thank you for the wonderful welcome!

In a recent post, I wrote about being a "stone" builder from Georgia learning to "build with wood" here in Canada. The journey has been about finding the right project and the right team to build with. I'm so grateful to have found that at HPN.

The mission to help lead a transformative new chapter for the company is the perfect challenge to roll up my sleeves for. It‚Äôs a chance to blend solid, time-tested architecture with the speed and flexibility of modern innovation.

To the entire HPN team: I‚Äôm ready to start building. To the Winnipeg community: thank you for your incredible support.
#NewBeginnings #TechLeadership
text:
Hilltop Partner Network is pleased to welcome Shota Megrelishvili to our team. Shota joins us as the Technical Lead for our new AI-enabled software development initiative.

Shota is a senior technologist and founder-minded leader with more than 12 years of experience designing and scaling full-stack platforms across EdTech, media, and financial services. He has served as CTO, team lead, and hands-on engineer for multiple global ventures, delivering complex applications powered by technologies like Node.js, React, Redis, MongoDB, and major cloud platforms including AWS, GCP, and Azure.

With a proven track record of launching MVPs, leading DevOps transformations, integrating AI into product experiences, and mentoring cross-functional teams, Shota brings a full-spectrum approach to technology leadership. His background spans from building consumer platforms used by hundreds of thousands of users to optimizing infrastructure for performance, security, and scale. 

We‚Äôre thrilled to have Shota on board to help lead this transformative chapter in HPN‚Äôs journey. Please join us in welcoming him to the team!

#WelcomeToTheTeam #TechLeadership #HilltopPartnerNetwork #FullStackDeveloper #CloudEngineering #DevOps #LeadershipInTech #AIIntegration

A proud moment for Georgia‚Äôs industrial future ‚Äî this investment not only strengthens our economy but also proves that world-class facilities can be delivered here at home
#IndustrialDevelopment #Manufacturing #Engineering #ProjectManagement #Georgia #LSGSolutions #Innovation #Borjomi
text:
Today, IDS Borjomi Georgia officially opened its New Factory, equipped with advanced technology. The project represents a total investment of 120 million USD, with a facility covering an area of 48 000 m¬≤, making it the largest  of its kind in Georgia.

LSG Solutions provided full management services - proper layout of production lines, integration of engineering solutions, and strict control over quality and safety. A team of highly experienced engineers and specialists worked on the project.

IDS Borjomi entrusted LSG Solutions at the early stage of the company‚Äôs foundation, and we are proud to have contributed to building the largest enterprise of its kind in Georgia.

poster.headline: Founder @ onibi (Tomo: Endless Blue)

text:
Gamescom did not go as expected this year! üéÆ‚ú®

Aside from the many investor and partner meetings, I hosted a small impromptu community meet & greet by posting on Twitter, Discord, and sending a few emails. I expected just a handful of people, but more than 40 players showed up and filled every slot to test our demo. In hindsight, bringing only two ROG Ally X devices was clearly not enough‚Ä¶ I definitely underestimated the turnout! üòÖ

The feedback was incredibly insightful and it sparked a wave of new fans joining our Discord, already sharing art, ideas, and a ton of kindness. Moments like these remind me why we are building Tomo: Endless Blue. üíô

(And yes, I may or may not have trolled the Pok√©mon AZ line by letting people play Tomo while waiting for their demo slot, then interviewing them after they had tried both ü§≠)

attributes.headline: Senior Product Designer Building GCast ¬∑ UX Strategist ¬∑ Scalable Systems

text:
Meet Th√©o ‚Äì the designers behind GCast

Before joining us, Th√©o worked as an independent designer on the Game UI Design team of Humankind, the acclaimed 4X strategy game from Amplitude Studios.

With his eye for clarity and elegant details, he brings a strong vision of implicit, intuitive, and neat design to our product.

Here‚Äôs what players had to say about the Humankind UI:

‚ÄúThe basic User Interface (UI) is as neat as it gets. Yes, it has way too many features compared to a traditional Civilization game, but the UI simply makes much of the things self-explanatory.‚Äù 
‚ÄúThe UI does a lot to make the game quite visually appealing.‚Äù 
‚ÄúIf you are a game UI nerd like me, check it out.‚Äù

We‚Äôre excited to see Th√©o apply the same passion for thoughtful design to shaping the future of Gcast.

poster.headline: Platform Engineer | PlayStation | Y Combinator S20 Co-founding Team at Jam.gg

text:
TLDR; üéÆ I built an¬†autotesting framework from scratch, with PlayStation as the main client.
Want to get autotesting coverage on your games or improve what you have? Let's talk!

After attending the autotesting roundtables at the Game Developers Conference last year, I realized that the video game industry still relies almost entirely on manual testing. For many studios, the idea of having automated testing pipelines and scenarios seems too difficult or unattainable.

But here‚Äôs what I managed to do:

- ü§ñ Automate tests on a catalog of 5,000+ games across different environments, running on every commit.

- üß™ Create a farm of dev kits to test not only on PC, but also on the different consoles on the market.

- ‚úÖ Provide peace of mind to developers, as manual testers are unable to ensure non-regression with every single commit.

- üßë‚Äçüíª Give both developers and QA teams an easy way to create their own tests and add them to the pipeline.

- üî¨ Achieve a certain testing power by comparing images, audio, performance, logs, and more.

Ultimately, I had a blast doing this. It's rewarding to build solutions that are uncommon in the industry and see them work‚Äîand even realize there's a ton of untapped potential (yeah, I was doing this before ChatGPT, lol).

I'd be really interested in applying my knowledge and experience to your games, whether you're using well-known or proprietary engines!

If this sounds interesting to you, or you just want to discuss it or compare experiences, I'd be happy to chat! Feel free to ping me on LinkedIn. üòÅ

#GameDev #AutomatedTesting #QA #DevOps #VideoGames

poster.headline: CTO @ Hilltop Partner Network | Engineering Leadership & AI Strategy | Building 0-to-1 Tech | Georgia to Winnipeg üç∑

text:
The startup world moves fast, and my first few weeks in the Canadian tech ecosystem have already been a masterclass in professional growth.

A recent, short engagement taught me something invaluable:

For any successful leadership role ‚Äî especially at the founding level ‚Äî there must be deep alignment on vision, working style, and mutual respect. A title is just a word. Real partnership is the foundation.

Recognizing early when that alignment isn‚Äôt there ‚Äî and stepping away with clarity ‚Äî is not a setback. It‚Äôs a decision rooted in self-awareness and integrity.

I‚Äôm grateful for the clarity this experience has given me and excited to connect with teams where shared values and long-term trust are the starting point. The journey continues!

poster.headline: CTO @ Hilltop Partner Network | Engineering Leadership & AI Strategy | Building 0-to-1 Tech | Georgia to Winnipeg üç∑

text:
Something I‚Äôve noticed in my first few months here in Winnipeg is how everything is built with wood. It‚Äôs fast, flexible, and smells like progress. It‚Äôs beautiful. 

It's also completely different from where I come from. üòâ

Back in Georgia, we build with stone. Our fortresses have stood for over a thousand years. Stone is about permanence, resilience, and deep, unshakeable foundations. It‚Äôs heavy. It‚Äôs slow. It‚Äôs meant to last forever. 

This got me thinking about how we build companies and software. 

For many years in IT, I've worked with both "stone" and "wood". 

Stone is the legacy monolith, the critical database, the enterprise ERP system you customize... It's powerful and reliable, but a nightmare to change. 

Wood is the agile microservice, the React front-end, the serverless function. You can build an MVP in weeks. You can pivot, adapt, and scale quickly. But it requires constant maintenance to weather the storms. 

I‚Äôve seen leaders who only love stone, and their companies become fossils. I‚Äôve seen leaders who only love wood, and their platforms collapse in the first high wind. üí®  

üí° The real art is in the architecture. It's knowing how to reinforce a stone foundation with a flexible wooden frame. It‚Äôs about choosing the right material for the right job, ensuring the whole structure is sound, secure, and ready for the future. 

My journey in Winnipeg feels a bit like this. I'm a "stone" guy learning to love the craft of building with "wood." It‚Äôs a new environment and a new way of thinking. And I‚Äôm finding that the principles of building something strong, beautiful, and lasting are universal. 

What is your company built with? Stone, wood, or a hybrid of both? I'd love to hear your stories. 

#TechLeadership #CTO #SoftwareArchitecture #StartupLife #WinnipegTech #GeorgiaToCanada #Newcomer
